answerText: Nicolas Léonard Sadi Carnot[10] This power cycle is conceptually similar to the Carnot cycle, except that isentropic compression occurs in the liquid phase and the liquid is then heated to saturation temperature to restart the cycle. It's closely approximated by steam turbines.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | Louisville Round 11 | 5 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This person's power cycle has two isothermal and two isentropic steps. For 10 points each: [10] Name this French scientist whose namesake, ideal power cycle is the theoretical maximum amount of work that can be obtained from a heat engine.
